adOHRi transmits the audio description (AD) of select short film programmes to your ear. This way you can receive the film description directly at the cinema and experience the diversity of short films.
The number of accessible short films is steadily growing and more and more short film programmes are being put together by distributors. Ask your local cinema for an accessible screening. The goal is to make short films accessible for everybody.
Bring your own headphones and start the app. The audio description gets transmitted to your mobile device via Wi-Fi. You can control the volume on your mobile device. Thus, you can experience the original film audio through the cinema's audio system and the audio description through your headphones.

The audio description will not play through your mobile device's inbuilt speaker. So make sure your headphones are connected. For an optimal experience, bring a charged mobile device to the screening and use wired headphones if possible.
In order to optimize reception of the audio description, adOHRi may disconnect your mobile device from the internet until you quit the app.

What is an audio description?
An audio description turns the film into an aural experience. Settings, actors, facial expressions and cinematography are put into words by professional audio description writers. The visual descriptions for blind and visually impaired audience-members are narrated during dialogue pauses.

This measure was co-financed with tax money based on the budget passed by the Saxon state parliament.
